data.title: Great food, good Margarita, good service
data.text: Excellent food and very good "house tequila" margarita. Complimentary chips and salsa. Very reasonably priced. Very good service. Not really fancy, but a great neighborhood restrauant!

data.title: Awesome place
data.text: Best Mexican food in town. Awesome specials and great options. The chicken flautas are excellent as is Emillos Burrito . Lots of locals eat here for lunch, delivery is affordable and quick !

data.title: Good Mexican food
data.text: Been there a few times. Good tacos and margaritas. They have a different special every day. Always people in there and I noticed a lot of carry-out too.

data.title: Great choice for a road trip stop
data.text:
Traveling on I-80 requires a break and we stopped in at Primos. A very casual restaurant with great service (thanks Raquel) and food served quick enough for a driving break.

Emilio’s Special Burrito
Smothered burrito filled with choice of meat, beans, rice & queso.Topped with hot or mild green chile, melted cheese, lettuce, tomato & sour cream.  - ordered with their Carne Asada and hot green chile; it has some heat and great flavor.

Carne Asada Chimichanga - very good Carne Asada

Ala carte cheese enchiladas were HUGE and very good.

Recommended if you are sick of fast food and want a better choice while on the road.

data.title: Great authentic Mexican food and wonderful value
data.text: Primo's is my go-to local place for a good non-chain restaurant.  The chips and salsa are great and they have wonderful daily specials as well.

data.title: GREAT mexican food
data.text: this place is the best in town for mexican food..all their items are fresh, and plentiful..the place is small...so it fills up quickly...our fav. mexican food in town

data.title: Love it!
data.text: We stop here for lunch whenever we're working in the area. I've always had fast friendly service and exceptional food. The tacos are great but my favorite is Rob's tamale trolley, it's a feast. They have a few different salsas with one that will give you a good sweat.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in a Long Time
data.text:
Our food at Primo's was phenomenal.  We haven't found great, authentic Mexican food near us.  This is the best Mexican in the Omaha area from what my wife and I have seen. 

We ate the burrito which was really great, and reasonably priced.   The tamales were strong and my wife enjoyed the chips and salsa.  Ask for their hot and mild house salsas, made fresh each day.  They were generous with chips and also, which isn't always the case.  

Service was fast and quite pleasant.  It's a family-owned place.  

It wasn't the cleanest restaurant we've been to, but don't let that deter you.  When in Omaha or Council Bluffs, make this trip.

data.title: Good food and service at this Mexican restaurant, but use the rest room before you go!
data.text: Just finished eating at this establishment. Good service and food, fresh salsa, and great corn tacos. Tortilla chips are good, but could have been a little fresher. The bathroom was disgusting, and not even heated. It had an odor, and hadn't been updated in decades!

data.title: Primos Mexican Restaurant
data.text: This is a nice restaurant that serves you chips and salsa free.  Reasonable prices and food is good.  Have eaten there several times.  The only bad thing is they don't have a lot of parking there but you can park on the side street.

data.title: Yummy Lunch
data.text: Went here to lunch on Sunday.  Ordered a Lunch special of 1 taco & 1 enchilada.  Both very good and enjoyed the warm chips and cold salsa.

data.title: Nickel and dime you
data.text: Never been to a Mexican restaurant that charges for a second bowl of salsa with your chips or a second lemonade. Call when they open to ask for beans without lard and they will gladly oblige. Food was good, not great, large portions. Service was exceptional.

data.title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE
data.text: LOOKING FOR AUTHENTIC MEXICAN, I DECIDED TO STOP HERE, ON A SUNDAY AT NOON.......ORDERED TAKE OUT NACHOS LOCOS AND SHRIMP FAJITAS. I discovered not authentic. Nachos could've been good but they were smothered in a"cheese wiz" type sauce and were loaded with "too large sized" chunks of peppers $$= find some place else.

data.title: Horrible, Horrible service
data.text:
I live right around the corner from this establishment. When they first opened I figured "Great" I'd have a close establishment to patronize. So the first time I ordered the Emilio's special to-go. They said it would take 25 to 30 min before I could Pick it up. I waited 25 minutes to pick it up and once I arrived, I sat there another 10 min waiting for anyone to acknowledge my presence. There was only one other party dining in there. I called over the bar tender, as I was sitting at the bar without being asked if I wanted something to drink, and asked how long before my order would be ready, he acted like I just took away his best friend, he was not happy. Then he hung up the phone and brought my order to me then rang it up and never even said thank you or you're welcome when I thanked him. I got home and the food was cold. It was nasty. The burrito was flavorless and the beans were bland. I swore I would never patronize that establishment again.
Then yesterday my husband and I decided to just go out for a drink and My husband figured how could they screw up a bottle of beer so we went to Primos since it was close by. We walked in and the waitress asked if there was just two in the party and we said yes and we would just sit at the bar. She continued to the next customers. We sat directly in front of the bar tender, who was chatting and laughing with a friend on the phone. He didn't acknowledge us at all. We sat there for almost 10 minutes with him just enjoying his conversation on the phone. So I suggested loudly to my husband that we should go to Applebees instead where we could get some service. He didn't even flinch and continued talking on the phone. I wouldn't step foot in that place again if you paid me. And I will tell everyone I know what a lousy place this is unless you are latino then they may treat you better. I wouldn't even give them one star but the system won't let me give them no stars or minus stars.

data.title: Primos
data.text: Had the daily special and it was excellent.  Service was great and the server attentive.  Prices very reasonable.  Always a daily special and they also have lunch specials.

data.title: Won't be Back
data.text:
Went with family and a friend on a Sunday evening arriving around 5:30. The place was mostly empty and the hostess/waitress told us to sit where ever we liked. By the time we finished there were only a few empty tables. 
Wait staff was friendly and efficient.  We ordered drinks and then after we got those my wife asked for a large order of chips and salsa which was listed on the menu. The waitress said something like "you'll get those included. I just haven't gotten around to it yet". I found this an odd thing to say but she was back in a few minutes with the chips. 
I ordered the beef chimichanga which came with refried beans. The food arrived at the table hot and in a timely manner.  The ground beef was a bit bland. My teen son ordered the same thing and thought it was spiced properly so maybe it was just me. The refried beans had a bit of a smoky taste to them which was different but tasted good. 
The consensus from the group was the tacos were the best. Fried shells and good fresh fillings. 
The main reason I don't plan to come back is the atmosphere. Primos is located in a former convience store. It's loud and hard to have a conversation with your neighbors.  They have a "juke box" which was extremely loud. My wife asked them if they could turn it down and a few minutes later, during a lull in the music, I overhead a lady at the next table complain as well. The waitress said "she said she already turned it down but I'll ask again." 
Besides the loud music the air quality was poor. We came out of the restaurant reeking of the smell of grease.  
They have a bar that extends the full length of the back wall. We didn't have any alcohol so I can't comment on the selection.  
Primos food is adequate but you can find better in Council Bluffs.  Good neighborhood spot if you are in a hurry but I won't go out of my way to visit again.

data.title: enjoyed it very much
data.text: it was great. I had the emilio's special burrito & it was great. Then we ordered fried ice cream. it was awesome

data.title: Not real Mexican cuisine
data.text:
We like Mexican foods and we tried a few restaurants.  
This one left us disappointed.  Just like many Chinese restaurants that make US versions of their foods, this place does the same with Mexican cuisine.  

Either the locals don't know what real Mexican food should taste like, or they don't care.  The place was busy with locals, but we sure won't waste time on our next trip.

data.title: A family favorite
data.text:
Great little place that not everyone knows about. We love their steak tacos, enchiladas and chimichangas. 
Prices are reasonable and service is friendly. Great neighborhood restaurant. 
Daily specials on tacos and enchiladas for $2.00. One of our favorites!

data.title: Went way downhill !
data.text: The atmosphere is bad the decor is bad the service sucks the portions are small and plain! The chicken enchilada was good but everything else was poor! And its too pricey, the tacos are small and have no flavor. Would not recommend this place to anyone !
